Argentina: First Jesuit missions to the Guaraní founded in the Upper Paraná area
Belgium: Death of Joannes Bochius, secretary to the city of Antwerp
Twelve Years' Truce agreed in Antwerp
Burma: Portuguese mercenary Tibao captures Sandwip in East Bengal, northernmost Arakanese territory
Germany: The Catholic League, an alliance of Catholic German princes, was established.
Ireland: Plantation of Ulster by Scottish Presbyterians began on a large scale.
Russia: Vasili ceded border territory to Sweden in exchange for military aid against the government of False Dmitriy II.
Polish–Muscovite War (1609–1618): The Polish king Sigismund III led an army into Muscovy.
Spain: The Expulsion of the Moriscos began.
Taiwan: The Tokugawa Shogunate sends feudal lord Arima Harunobu on an exploratory mission to Taiwan.
USA: At first, the natives were glad to trade provisions to the colonists for metal tools, but by 1609 John Smith began sending raiding parties to demand food. Native Americans were isolated, their houses burnt down, and their food supplies were stolen. This earned the colonists a bad reputation among the natives and precipitated conflict.
